required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Continuous Glucose Monitors in Publicly-Insured Youth With Type 2 Diabetes - A Pilot and Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Continuous Glucose Monitors in Publicly-Insured Youth With Type 2 Diabetes - A Pilot and Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot feasibility study is to provide continued CGM access to youth with type 2 diabetes and collect descriptive data about feasibility of use of CGM in youth with type 2 diabetes ages 4 years and older. From this study the investigators hope to learn if CGM use in youth with type 2 diabetes can be tolerated and sustained with good adherence and to describe blood glucose patterns in youth with type 2 diabetes. The primary aim will be to evaluate the feasibility of CGM start and continuation in youth with T2D and describe glucose metrics and patient reported outcomes (PROs). The investigators will pilot and refine a program to test the hypothesis that CGM start and continuation in youth with T2D is feasible and then evaluate glucose metrics and PROs.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with sustained CGM use
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed over the 14 days prior to each clinic visit)
primary_outcome.description: Days of CGM use per each 14 day period

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in HbA1C at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed at each in person clinic visit, minimum is baseline and 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: change in HbA1C from baseline to 12 months of CGM use

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean percentage of glucose values in target range of 70-180 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed over the 14 days prior to each clinic visit)
secondary_outcome.description: percentage time in range, time in hypoglycemia, time in hyperglycemia

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean percentage of glucose values below 70 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed over the 14 days prior to each clinic visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean percentage of glucose values above 180 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed over the 14 days prior to each clinic visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Promis Global Health Scale score from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed at baseline, 3 months and 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Promis Global Health (Minimum=1, maximum=5 for each question, higher score for physical health questions is better outcome, higher score for mental health is worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PedsQoL3.2 score from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed at baseline, 3 months and 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PedsQL Diabetes Module version 3.2, (minimum 0, maximum 4, for each question, higher score is worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Use of and Comfort with Technology score from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed at baseline, 3 months and 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Use of and Comfort With Technology (Minimum = 1, Maximum =5 for each question, Higher score is better outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Problem Areas in Diabetes score from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year (assessed at baseline, 3 months and 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Problem Areas in Diabetes - Pediatric PRO Scale (Minimum 1, Maximum 6, from baseline, higher dose is worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in BMI from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: change in BMI over study duration while using CGM

arm_group.description: All participants will be included in this arm

intervention.description: Participants will be provided a continuous glucose monitor for use in self-glucose monitoring as per standard clinical care
Participants and their parents will be asked to complete patient reported outcome questionnaires at 3 study time points.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- public insurance
- between ages 4-19.99 years inclusive
- diagnosis of T2D (diabetes autoantibody negative) followed in the Pediatric Endocrinology clinic at Stanford Children's Health
- HbA1C greater than 6.5% at enrollment
- interested in starting on a continuous glucose monitor
- have access to a mobile device that is compatible with CGM applications or willing to use CGM receiver provided
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-T2D diagnosis
- HgA1C < 6.5%
- are not willing to wear CGM
- have private health insurance.

patient_data.ipd_description: All of the individual participant data collected during the trial after deidentification
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: immediately following publication. No end date.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal, for purpose of achieving aims in the approved proposal. Proposals should be directed to the protocol director and data sharing requests will need to follow current protocols in place at Stanford University.
